Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2009 01:48AM whoever0730 wrote: I also had severe radiation burns - I ended up having to go into specialized Wound Care.  They suggested 4 weeks of Hyperbariac Oxygen Chamber treatment.  It wasn't too bad, just boring.  You have to lay in the Oxygen Chamber for about 4 hours a day every weekday.  You can't take anything in with you, so I would bring a DVD & watch a movie each day.  My breast tissue was still very slow to heal, but it finally did.  The up side to the Oxygen Therapy is the rest of your skin looks flawless.  So ask your Radiation Oncologist about Wound Care - The specialized care is worth it. - Hope this helps & good luck.
